body:
Seriously, i try and make a good discussion. None are very successful. I make a video and post it to the forums and i am lucky to even get a reply. Then i see someone else do the same and they have like 3 - 4 comments. WHAT DOES IT TAKE.
Thanks, Endertait.

title: What does it take to make a good discussion?

replies.body:
make a thread about:
1) shoes
2) checking the dubs
3) what triggers you
replies.body_tagged:
make a thread about:
1) shoes
2) checking the dubs
3) what triggers you

replies.body: Could you give that to me in more detail?
replies.body_tagged: Could you give that to me in more detail?

replies.body: Well if people aren't interested in your thread then they aren't interested. You've gotta spice things up.
replies.body_tagged: Well if people aren't interested in your thread then they aren't interested. You've gotta spice things up.

replies.body:
Well unless your someone like Tynvale who's videos have some community interaction, then you've gotta step outside of the box and find something interesting besides monotonous gameplay that we've generally seen in one place or another. 

Brainstorm.wmv
replies.body_tagged:
Well unless your someone like Tynvale who's videos have some community interaction, then you've gotta step outside of the box and find something interesting besides monotonous gameplay that we've generally seen in one place or another. 

Brainstorm.wmv

replies.body: A captive title, and in the body of the thread you need to have a question that has multiple answers. Replies usually have reasoning, and then other players branch off that.
replies.body_tagged: A captive title, and in the body of the thread you need to have a question that has multiple answers. Replies usually have reasoning, and then other players branch off that.

replies.body: We don't roll for dubs here, Mooch.

replies.body:
Make detailed and interesting titles, but not misleading. 

But seriously, people might just not be interested
